summary: Donald Trump claimed at the Trump NRA on May 4th, 2018 that the US goes into wars to defend other countries' borders, but does not defend its own borders. He stated that the US will start defending its country and borders, as there is an influx of illegal migrants pouring in from Mexico, particularly from Central America. Trump criticized the existing laws, suggesting that they were written by individuals who do not truly love the country.

Donald Trump claimed at the Trump NRA on May 4th, 2018 that Senate Democrats like Jon Tester, Bill Nelson, and Bob Casey voted against Kate's Law and to protect sanctuary cities, which he believes is a disgrace and unpopular.

Donald Trump claimed at the Trump NRA on May 4th, 2018 that despite the phony Russia witch hunt, the employment numbers for African-Americans, Hispanic Americans, and women are at their lowest levels in history or almost 20 years.

Donald Trump claimed at the Trump NRA on May 4th, 2018 that he won the votes of African-Americans and that the numbers are now higher than ever. He also mentioned that Hispanic American and women's unemployment rates are at their lowest levels in history. Despite these achievements, Trump expressed frustration that the focus is on the "phony Russia witch hunt" instead.

Donald Trump claimed at the Trump NRA event on May 4th, 2018 that African-American, Hispanic-American, and women's unemployment rates are at their lowest levels in history or almost 20 years. He expressed frustration that the focus is on the "phony Russia witch hunt" instead of the positive employment numbers.

Donald Trump claimed at the Trump NRA event on May 4th, 2018 that in order to achieve their goals, Republicans need to win in the 2018 midterms. He emphasized the importance of appointing federal judges who will interpret the law as written and mentioned that his administration has already nominated and confirmed more circuit judges than any previous administration. Trump also mentioned that President Obama left them with a significant number of judges, almost 140.

Donald Trump claimed at the Trump NRA event on May 4th, 2018 that the United States has the worst laws and that the country goes into wars to defend other countries' borders instead of its own. He also mentioned the issue of illegal migrants pouring into the country through Mexico, particularly from Central American countries like Honduras.
